Publication Title: Microenvironmental stiffness induces metabolic reprogramming in glioblastoma
Publication Keywords: Extracellular matrix, Tissue Mechanics, Cp: Cancer, Cp: Metabolism
Publication Authors: Alireza Sohrabi, Austin E Y T Lefebvre, Mollie J Harrison, Michael C Condro, Talia M Sanazzaro, Gevick Safarians, Itay Solomon, Soniya Bastola, Shadi Kordbacheh, Nadia Toh, Harley I Kornblum, Michelle A Digman, Stephanie K Seidlits
Publication Abstract: The mechanical properties of solid tumors influence tumor cell phenotype and the ability to invade surrounding tissues. Using bioengineered scaffolds to provide a matrix microenvironment for patient-derived glioblastoma (GBM) spheroids, this study demonstrates that a soft, brain-like matrix induces GBM cells to shift to a glycolysis-weighted metabolic state, which supports invasive behavior.
